IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Provide a robust educational and cultural experience for students who learn differently.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Centreville Layton School offers a robust educational and cultural experience for students who learn differently. The program identifies academic and social needs of the individual and provides a curriculum that focuses on problem solving and critical thinking. Through intervention and strengthening learning strategies, the School empowers each student to reach his or her potential.
IRS990.Desc: Centreville Layton School is dedicated to early detection and remediation of developmentally-delayed, learning-disordered children. There were 112 students enrolled during the year.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: HoS (from 9/22), Head of Up and Mid Sch (to 8/22)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School has adopted investment and spending policies for endowment assets that attempt to provide a predictable stream of funding to programs supported by its endowment while seeking to maintain the purchasing power of the endowment assets. Endowment assets include those assets of donor-restricted funds that the School must hold in perpetuity or for a donor-specified period(s). Under this policy, as approved by the Board of Directors, the endowment assets are invested in a manner that is intended to maintain the level of financial support currently provided while assuming a moderate level of investment risk.

The following excerpt appears on both the Centreville Layton School brochure and application: Centreville Layton School is nonprofit, nonsectarian & accepts students without regard to race, creed or national origin. Admission decisions are made with the best interests of the child and the family at the center, and acceptances are based on whether the child will benefit from the program and support services offered.

The School's scholarship and financial aid grants are awarded through an application and evaluation process. Applicants must demonstrate their need. An outside 3rd party organization processes applications and makes recommendations to the School's Committee regarding the applicants' proven need for financial assistance. The Committee, comprised of School personnel, reviews the recommendations from the 3rd party organization and approves the financial aid awarded. Approximately 35 grants are awarded per year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Draft versions of the Form 990 are distributed to all members of the Board for approval prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All directors have a duty to disclose conflicts of interest when the conflict becomes apparent to the individual. When the conflict arises, the Director shall disclose his/her conflict of interest to the Board of Directors and shall refrain from discussions and votes on the issues that are the reason for the conflict.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Executive Committee of the Board serves as the Head of School Compensation Committee in consultation with the Board Finance Committee. The Committee reviews local salary data to help establish current market values for the School's executive position. The Committee reviews and approves compensation in conjunction with the operating budget approval for the next fiscal year.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There currently exists no legal requirement to make governing documents, conflict of interest policies or audited financial statements publicly available. The School has never received a request for information of this type. If any requests for this information should be received, they would be evaluated by the Directors on a case by case basis. In general, the Directors believe that the information available on this form would be more than sufficient to respond to most legitimate inquiries.
The School has an Audit & Finance Committee that assumes responsibility for oversight of the financial statement audit and the selection of the independent auditors.
